alert.note: Alert for Gillespie; Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 4:23AM CDT until October 26 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Gillespie, Kerr and Llano. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kerrville, Fredericksburg, Kingsland, Llano, Comfort, Gainesville, Horseshoe Bay, Ingram, Buchanan Lake Village, Stonewall, Rocky Hill, Eckert, Cain City, Blumenthal, Willow City, Luckenbach, Grapetown, LBJ State Park, Tivydale and Albert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
